gurmukhi: lK rwm rUp ]AiqBuq AnUp ]jh huqI sUp ]qh gey BUp ]330]
transliteration: Laakh Raam Roop|| Atibhout Anoop|| Jah Houtisoop|| Tah Gad Bhoop||330||
translation: Ram had a marvellous body, when he came out after bath, on seeing his beauty the official of the place went to the royal lady Surapanakha.330.

gurmukhi: khI qwih Dwiq ]suin sUp bwiq ]duAY AiqQ nwq ]lih AnUp gwq ]331]
transliteration: Kahitaah(i) Dhaat(i)|| Soun(i) Soop Baat(i)|| Duai Atith Naat|| Lah(i) Anoop Gadt||331||
translation: They said to her, “Please listen to us O royal lady ! two strangers of unique bodies have come to our kingeom.”331.

gurmukhi: sUpnKw ieh BwNq sunI jb ]Dwie clI AiblMb qiRXw qb ]
transliteration: Soopnakhaa Eh Bhaant Sanijab|| Dhaae Chaliabilanb Triyaa Tab||
translation: When Surapanakha heard these words, she immediately started and reaching there,

gurmukhi: kwm srUp klyvr jwnY ]rUp AnUp iqhUM pur mwnY ]332]
transliteration: Kaamaroop Kalevar Jaanai|| Roop Anoop Tihoon Pur Maanai||332||
translation: She considered all of them as Cupid-incarnate and believed in her mind that no one equaled them in beauty.332.

gurmukhi: Dwie khXo rGurwie Bey iq`h ]jYs niRlwj khY n koaU ik`h ]
transliteration: Dhaae Kahyo Raghuraae Bhae Tih|| Jais Nrilaaj Kahai Na Ko( i)  Kihh||
translation: Coming before Ram, without feeling ashamed, she said :

gurmukhi: hau AtkI qumrI Cib ky br ]rMg rMgI rMgey diRg dUpr ]333]
transliteration: Hau Atkitoumrichhab(i)ke Bar|| Ran Raniranad Drig Doopar||333||
translation: “I have halted here because of your beauty and my mind is dyed with the dye of your intoxicated eyes.”333.

gurmukhi: jwh qhwN jh BRwq hmwry ]vY irJhY lK nYn iqhwry ]
transliteration: Jaah Tahaan Jah Bhraat Hamdare|| Vai Rijh-hai Lakh Nain Tihdare||
translation: “You go to the place of my brother who will be bewitched on seeing your beautiful eyes;

gurmukhi: sMg sIAw Aivlok kiRsodr ]kYsy kY rwK sko qum k`au Gir ]334]
transliteration: San Seeaa Avilok Krisodar|| Kaise Kai Raakh Sako Toum Kau Ghar(i)||334||
translation: “You can see that with me there is Sita of beautiful waist and in such a situation how can I keep you in my house.334.

gurmukhi: mwq ipqw kh moh qjXo mn ]sMg iPrI hmry bn hI bn ]
transliteration: Maat Pitaa Kah Tajyo Man|| San Phirihamre Ban Hiban||
translation: “She has abandoned the attachment towards her parents and is roaming with me in the forest;

gurmukhi: qwih qjO ks kY suin suMdr ]jwhu qhwN jhwN BRwq kiRsodr ]335]
transliteration: Taah(i) Tajau Kas Kai Soun(i) Soundar|| Jaahu Tahaan Jahaan Bhraat Krisodar||335||
translation: “O beautiful lady! How can I forsake her, you go there where my brother is sitting.”335.

gurmukhi: jwq BeI sun bYn qiRXw qh ]bYT huqy rxDIr jqI jh ]
transliteration: Jaat Bhaisoun Bain Triyaa Tah|| Baith Houte Randheer Jatijah||
translation: Hearing these words of Ram, that lady Surpanakha went there were Lakshman was sitting.
